page.title: 17Carey House
page.content: Carey House was opened in 1931 as a convalescent home,by the Carey family who were lace manufacturers in Nottingham,for their workers.Now it has been taken over and used for D.H.S.S. patients.All 18 are from Lincolnshire and stay for 2 weeks. Accommodation is in ground floor rooms holding 2 or more people.When we were there,some of the patients were having a rest on their beds or in the sitting room.For those who were awake,card games,darts,snooker,jig-saws,etc.,were available.Others had gone out for a walk or even afternoon tea.The patients who were awake were eager to talk to us and enjoyed our visit. One lady said she wished she could join the staff and stay permanently as she was thoroughly enjoying herself.As we left we saw wild rabbits playing on the grass near the trees and flowers.
